intro: Wisteria koreana, commonly known as the Korean wisteria, is a deciduous climbing vine native to Korea. It is characterized by its long, flexible stems that can climb and twine around supports. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pendulous flowers in shades of purple or blue, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are compound, consisting of 10-20 oval-shaped leaflets. Wisteria koreana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens and as a landscape plant.
